comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: No, this is the John Wanamaker store at Broadway and Tenth Avenue in New York City. The balloon was launched from the rooftop here on July 8, 1911. It intended to go to Philadelphia, but got lost in fog, and ended up in West Nyack. The New York Times ran a story on July 9, 1911: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9506E0D71431E233A... Another Bain/LOC photo of the Wanamaker balloon: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163757324/in/photostream/] And another: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2162964525/in/photostream/] Balloonist Leo Stevens in the basket of the Wanamaker balloon: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163708034/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2162732173/]
